column5: Heading up to Nungesser Lake on June 29; wondering if I can get a report on whether the mayfly hatch has occured yet or any idea when it might occur. If anybody has been to Nungesser lately a fishing report would be appreciated. Tight Lines
I spoke to a camp owner on gull Rock last Wednesday and the mayflies had not hatched there yet.

i got back from a fly-in out of red lake on june 23rd,and we started to see may-flys the kast two days we were there.the lakes we fished max out @ 30 ft so these may warm up faster then the one you are going to
May flies started in small numbers around the 21st/22nd. Just got back from Sportsman's.HOP

Please e-mail me....I'm headed to Nungesser 7/13, first time there... talked to the lodge owner a couple days ago, sounds like good fishing.. [email protected]Tried to e-mail you direct-but wouldn't work yet. THX

RiceburnerI've fished nungesser for six years until switching to Eagle lake in 98. (wanted someplav=ce we could take our own boats) There are only two lodges on the lake so not a lot of pressure. A great ride up Nungesser river to get to the lake and the fishing that time of year always good. Enjoy your trip!
